timeline.title: Agreement Effective Date
timeline.description: Agreement takes effect contingent upon prior approval by COMMISSION governing board. CONSULTANT commences work after notification to proceed by Contract Manager.

timeline.title: First Progress Report and Invoice Submission
timeline.description: CONSULTANT submits first written progress report with itemized invoice within 45 days of work performance, including labor details, expenses, and cumulative charges.

timeline.title: Mid-Term Review
timeline.description: COMMISSION conducts interim audit and review of CONSULTANT's performance, compliance with milestones, and insurance maintenance.

timeline.title: Final Deliverable Submission
timeline.description: CONSULTANT submits all deliverables, final progress report, and final invoice within 60 days after acceptance of work by Contract Manager.

timeline.title: Agreement End Date
timeline.description: Agreement terminates unless extended by contract amendment or earlier termination occurs.

penalty_forecast.label: Month 1
penalty_forecast.description: Initial payment with processing fees and reimbursable expenses as per Fee Schedule

penalty_forecast.label: Month 3
penalty_forecast.description: Accumulated late fees for delayed invoice submission and penalties for missed milestones without approval

penalty_forecast.label: Month 6
penalty_forecast.description: Maximum penalty scenario including reprocurement costs for default termination and indemnification claims

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Convenience by COMMISSION
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: None; CONSULTANT receives payment for work done

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Default by COMMISSION
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Full; CONSULTANT liable for all reasonable costs including reprocurement

exit_comparisons.label: Termination by CONSULTANT with 120-day notice
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Partial; CONSULTANT liable for costs but avoids some penalties

narratives.title: Default Termination Due to Insurance Lapse
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT fails to maintain required insurance coverage
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT's commercial general liability insurance expires without renewal or notice. COMMISSION issues a 10-day cure notice, but CONSULTANT does not rectify. COMMISSION terminates for default, invoking reprocurement costs of ₹100,000 for new consultant services, plus indemnification for any damages incurred during the lapse.

narratives.title: Late Invoice Submission Penalties
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT submits invoices beyond 45-day deadline
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT delays invoice submission by 15 days, missing the 45-day deadline. COMMISSION imposes late fees of ₹5,000 per occurrence and delays payment until compliance. Repeated delays trigger higher penalties and risk of termination for breach.
key_points: Invoices must be submitted within 45 days

long_term.label: Year 1
long_term.description: Total contract value with base payments, fees, and estimated reimbursables

long_term.label: Year 2
long_term.description: Cumulative costs if agreement extended, including inflation adjustments and additional services

long_term.label: Year 3
long_term.description: Maximum exposure including potential penalties, reprocurement, and legal costs from disputes

risk_alerts.message: Failure to maintain required insurance coverage can lead to immediate termination for default and significant financial penalties.
Delayed invoice submission beyond 45 days results in late fees and potential payment holds, impacting cash flow.
Non-compliance with indemnification clauses exposes CONSULTANT to unlimited liability for damages, legal fees, and government claims.
